example.title: Git Commands User Manual
example.overview: This manual provides a comprehensive guide to Git commands used in this project. It covers basic operations, branching strategies, and collaboration workflows. The content is organized into chapters for easy reference.

chapters.title: Basic Commands
chapters.content: Git provides essential commands for version control. The `git init` command initializes a repository [[1]](#ref-1), while `git clone` creates a local copy [[2]](#ref-2). These commands form the foundation of Git workflows.

chapters.title: Branching Strategy
chapters.content: Branching enables parallel development. The `git branch` command manages branches [[3]](#ref-3), and `git checkout` switches between them [[4]](#ref-4). This strategy isolates feature development from the main codebase.
